meanings.meaning: a (real, royal) pain in the ass

examples.korean: I am just a(n) annoyance[nuisance] to him. 발음듣기 그는 나를 눈엣가시로 여긴다 Neungyule
examples.english: I am just a(n) annoyance[nuisance] to him. 발음

examples.korean: That burned-out house is the eyesore of the neighborhood. 발음듣기 그 타버린 집은 이웃들의 눈엣가시이다. Neungyule
examples.english: That burned-out house is the eyesore of the neighborhood. 발음

examples.korean: I don't like him as he is a pain in the neck. 발음듣기 나는 그가 눈엣가시이므로 그를 좋아하지 않는다. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I don't like him as he is a pain in the neck. 발음

examples.korean: My stepmother regarded me as an eyesore[as if I always stood in her way]. 발음듣기 계모는 언제나 나를 눈엣가시처럼 여겼다 Dong-a's Prime English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: My stepmother regarded me as an eyesore[as if I always stood in her way]. 발음

examples.korean: In World War II, German submarines were a real thorn in Britain's side. 발음듣기 제2차 세계대전 당시 독일 잠수함들은 영국으로서는 눈엣가시였다 Dong-a's Prime English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: In World War II, German submarines were a real thorn in Britain's side. 발음
